Topic.Title: DOD VETS get furloughed this week for 11 weeks, Wall Street say they support VETS , but they don't

Message.Msg: these are (for the most part) civilian contractors, not veterans, and GM IS paying back their bailout (albeit, slower than anticipated). Your message is not only muddled, it's just plain silly. Go back to the mint

Topic.Title: DOD VETS get furloughed this week for 11 weeks, Wall Street say they support VETS , but they don't

Message.Msg: "these are (for the most part) civilian contractors, not veterans, and GM IS paying back their bailout (albeit, slower than anticipated). Your message is not only muddled, it's just plain silly. Go back to the mint" Something has to give. The gov't can't just keep spending. So there were no July 4 fireworks at many military bases. In some cases they spent $100k on big fireworks displays. And we need priorities. The $7 b to build electric grids in Africa will necessitate further cutbacks. So who's going to cry about some DOD contractors?

Topic.Title: DOD VETS get furloughed this week for 11 weeks, Wall Street say they support VETS , but they don't

Message.Msg: The almost 800,000 DOD workers are about 90% veterans and work for the GOV not contractors, That's right Wall Street which runs Congress does not have the right priorities and they need to be shown that we need to take care of our DOD VETS

Buck up! The labor force the last ten years has lived the mantra of fake it til you make it. They job hop like never before with absolutely no loyalty. They were taught they were all winners and have been stricken by the Coddling Virus. So they axe some of them...it is what they want.

Message.Title: The sand bunnies will be hurling rocks for 50 years.
Message.Msg: Reminds me of the TV series Rat Patrol. They all drive beat up 20 year old jeeps and land rovers shooting guns in the air. This is what they signed up for...let em battle it out.

Topic.Title: DOD VETS get furloughed this week for 11 weeks, Wall Street say they support VETS , but they don't

Message.Msg: Move to cash and support our DOD VETS send a message to Wall Street and Congress that it is wrong not to support our DOD VETS. What a slap in the face it was to our DOD VETS to furlough them the week after the 4th of July

Message.Title: Close into red...
Message.Msg: Fatty is down hard later ot tomorrow like Intel.

Topic.Title: DOD VETS get furloughed this week for 11 weeks, Wall Street say they support VETS , but they don't

Message.Msg: Right now the focus of the US is on building out the electric grid in Africa. Your DOD vets are a lot better off than the poor people of Africa. Your posts are selfish.

Topic.Title: DOD VETS get furloughed this week for 11 weeks, Wall Street say they support VETS , but they don't

Message.Msg: Support our DOD VETS move to cash and send a message to Wall Street and Congress that it is wrong not to support our DOD VETS

Yes, IBM has the legal right to lay off anyone at anytime. However, why don't they start with do-nothing managers? Why does IBM need so many VPs, directors, and GMs? IBM is top heavy. No, IBM stock holders should be grateful to American taxpayers for the lucrative contracts that IBM muscles from the US government. We are talking billions of dollars. IBM charges the government $200 per hour on a project, and then turns around and pays Indian or Chinese workers maybe $7 per hour. This is a major scam, and IBM is not the only corporation doing this.

IBM has laid off a majority of people who have been with the company 20+ years and many who are retirement eligible with 30+ years with the company! Your statement doesn't apply in this case. I'm an IBM employee, witnessing the layoffs first hand, I would know.

Message.Title: Up only five cents
Message.Msg: everybody waiting for earnings. Even the hedge funds have no guts here. No commitments. If we 'miss' ....God forbid, this thing could plummet big time. If we 'meet' , the best that IBM could do is advance two points and MAYBE hold this gain for the next two or three days. If we surprise.........its unpredictable how much IBM could advance and then HOLD this advance. These are my predictions and its IMVHO
